alert.note: Alert for Allendale; Dorchester; Hampton; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 10:11AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, HAMPTON, COLLETON, ALLENDALE AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 1010 AM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Barnwell to 6 miles southwest of Millett, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Allendale, Saint George, Colleton, Fairfax, Brunson, Reevesville, Sycamore and Smoaks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
